purpleculture_pinyin:
tuí
to crumble; to collapse; to decline; to decay; decadent; dejected; dispirited; balding
рассыпаться; свернуть; снижаться; разлагаться; декадентский; удрученный; удрученный; облысение
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 颓)
Ideographic: A bald 禿 head 頁; 禿 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
頹廢 [ tuí fèi ]: decadent; dispirited; depressed; dejected
頹然 [ tuí rán ]: decrepit; ruined; disappointed
頹喪 [ tuí sàng ]: dejected; disheartened; listless
頹唐 [ tuí táng ]: dispirited; depressed
頹勢 [ tuí shì ]: decline (in fortune)

heisig_chinese_memo: When you get old you get a bald head and your body and human legs slowly become decrepit like old wheat.
Ru_trainchinese: tuí: (графема) (книжн.) рушиться, разваливаться; приходить в упадок; унылый, удрученный
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A bald head and a decrepit body tend to go together when people age.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " bald " from " page ". Xiao Zhuan made "穨". "Shuowen": "Bald, bald. From bald, noble voice." Duan Yucai's note: "The modern vulgar word is for decadence." Later, " decadent " is used instead of "穨".

" Decadent " means falling. Xu Hao's "Shuowen Jiezi Annotation": "The bald person loses hair, so the extended meaning is depression." Such as "Chu Ci. Liu Xiang<Nine Sigh. "Fengfen": "The heart is melancholy with eternal thinking, and the meaning is dark and the sun is faint." Hong Xingzu's supplementary note: "Yuan, falling, and the same." "Lun Heng. Fatigue": "Those who are in trouble are in danger, those who are in abundance lose money, and those who fall are often hanging down."

" Decadent " means collapse. Such as "Book of Rites. "On Tan Gong": "Created by Confucius with a flea, holding his hand and dragging the stick, swaying to the door, the song said: "The mountain is slumped, the beam is bad, and the philosopher is withered!" "Selected Works. Bao Mingyuan's "Wucheng Fu": "Tongchi has been barbaric, but it has become depressed."

" Slumping " means that water flows downward. Such as "Historical Records. "Hequ Book": "Shuiyu is a beautiful business, and the east reaches the mountains for more than ten miles." Three Kingdoms Wei Cao Zhi "Wang Zhongxuan's": "From the Northern Wei Dynasty, as far as the Nanhuai. Experience the mountains and rivers, weeping like a stubborn tears."

" Decadent " means decline and decline. For example, Zhuge Liang of the Three Kingdoms Shu Zhuge Liang "Teacher Formation": "Professional ministers, far villain, this pre-Han is prosperous; prostitution, far sage, later Han is also depressed." Tang Dynasty Changsun Wuji, "Jin Lv Shu Yi Biao 〉: "Legal increase the disciplines of A and B, to pour vulgarity with righteousness; the system of rituals and ups and downs, to save the decadent wind.

" Decadent " means submission. Such as "Book of Rites. "Tan Gong Xia": "Worship, then jiying, and succumb to its success." Zheng Xuan's note: "Decadent, Shun also." Northern Song Su Shi's "Embaph of the Babysitter Yang": "On the 30th year, I began to belong to the Su clan, and I was fluent Shunshan too."

" Decadent " also means bad, and is mostly used for rants. For example, the second fold of the third book of Wang Shifu's "West Chamber" in the Yuan Dynasty: "Today is declining, it is rare to be late." Xiaoxiaosheng in the Ming Dynasty "Jin Ping Mei Ci Hua" Chapter 93: "If you can't endure the desolation, you have to find a dead end. No fate!"
humanum_short_description_en: From " bald " from " page ". " Decadent " means falling, collapse, decline, etc.
humanum_full_description:
從「禿」從「頁」。小篆作「穨」。《說文》：「穨，禿皃。从禿，貴聲。」段玉裁注：「今俗字作頹。」後多用「頹」而不用「穨」。

　　「頹」表示墜落。徐灝《說文解字注箋》：「禿者發落，故引申之義為頹落。」如《楚辭．劉向〈九嘆．逢紛〉》：「心怊悵以永思兮，意晻晻而日穨。」洪興祖補注：「穨，下墜也，與隤同。」《論衡．累害》：「處顛者危，勢豐者虧，頹墜之類，常在懸垂。」

　　「頹」表示崩塌。如《禮記．檀弓上》：「孔子蚤作，負手曳杖，消搖於門，歌曰：『泰山其頹乎，梁木其壞乎，哲人其萎乎！』」《文選．鮑明遠〈蕪城賦〉》：「通池既已夷，峻隅又已頹。」

　　「頹」表示水向下流。如《史記．河渠書》：「水穨以絕商顏，東至山嶺十餘里閒。」三國魏曹植〈王仲宣誄〉：「發軫北魏，遠迄南淮。經歷山河，泣涕如穨。」

　　「頹」表示衰微、衰敗。如三國蜀諸葛亮〈出師表〉：「親賢臣，遠小人，此先漢所以興隆也；親小人，遠賢士，此後漢所以傾頹也。」唐代長孫無忌〈進律疏議表〉：「律增甲乙之科，以正澆俗；禮崇升降之制，以拯頹風。」

　　「頹」表示恭順。如《禮記．檀弓下》：「拜而后稽顙，頹乎其順也。」鄭玄注：「頹，順也。」北宋蘇軾〈保母楊氏墓志銘〉：「年三十，始隸蘇氏，穨然順善也。」

　　「頹」也表示惡劣，多用於詈辭。如元代王實甫《西廂記》第三本第二折：「今日頹天，百般的難得晚。」明代笑笑生《金瓶梅詞話》第93回：「挨不過淒涼，要尋死路，百忙裡捨不的頹命！」
humanum_short_description: 從「禿」從「頁」。「頹」表示墜落、崩塌、衰微等。

    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
①崩壞，倒塌：頹壞。頹圮。頹垣斷壁。
②消沉，委靡：頹萎。頹喪。頹靡。頹唐。
③敗壞：衰頹。頹敗。頹景。頹朽。
④水向下流：泣涕如頹。
⑤滅亡：“親小人，遠賢臣，此後漢所以傾頹也”。
⑥恭順的樣子。
⑦暴風：“習習穀風，維風及頹”。

頹然 [ tuí rán ]: decrepit; ruined; disappointed

頹字的基本解释

頹
tuí
同“颓”。

頹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuí］
［《廣韻》杜回切，平灰，定。］
亦作“穨1”。“颓1”的繁体字。亦作“頹1”。亦作“頺1”。
(1)旋风；龙卷风。
(2)崩溃，坍塌。
(3)坠落。
(4)谓水向下流。
(5)流逝。
(6)败落；衰退。
(7)破败。
(8)指破坏。
(9)疾病。
(10)下垂貌；凹下貌。
(11)恭顺貌。
(12)詈词。恶劣之义。
(13)指坏家伙。
(14)雄马的生殖器。
(15)头秃貌。参见“頽然”。
(16)通“堆”。聚集；堆集。

頹字的康熙字典解释

頹字的起名意思

暂无。

decadent
Basic explanation of words
decadent
tuí
Same as "decadent".
decadent
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tuí］
["Guang Yun" Du Hui cut, flat gray, fixed. ]
Also known as "穨1". Traditional Chinese characters for "deca 1". Also known as "Decadent 1". Also known as "頺1".
(1) Cyclone; Tornado.
(2) Collapse, collapse.
(3) Falling.
(4) It is said that water flows downward.
(5) Elapsed.
(6) Decline; recession.
(7) Dilapidated.
(8) Refers to destruction.
(9) Disease.
(10) Drooping appearance; concave appearance.
(11) Submissive appearance.
(12) Abuse. Bad righteousness.
(13) Refers to the bad guy.
(14) The genitals of male horses.
(15) Bald appearance. See "slumping".
(16) Through "heap". Gather together.
decadent
